Nuts and seeds are a wonderful addition to quinoa and roasted veggies. A delicious and healthy sauce or dressing can elevate the flavors and textures of your meal. Here are some easy-to-make and nutritious options that require minimal ingredients:

**1. Lemon-Tahini Sauce:**
Mix 2 tablespoons of tahini, 1 tablespoon of freshly squeezed lemon juice, 1 minced garlic clove, and a pinch of salt. Add water as needed to achieve your desired consistency.

**2. Avocado Crema:**
Mash 1 ripe avocado and mix with 1 tablespoon of freshly squeezed lime juice, 1 minced garlic clove, and a pinch of salt. Add water as needed to achieve your desired consistency.

**3. Balsamic Vinaigrette:**
Whisk together 2 tablespoons of balsamic vinegar, 1 tablespoon of olive oil, 1 minced garlic clove, and a pinch of salt.

**4. Ginger-Soy Sauce:**
Mix 2 tablespoons of soy sauce, 1 tablespoon of freshly grated ginger, and 1 tablespoon of water.

**5. Cilantro-Lime Dressing:**
Blend 1/4 cup of fresh cilantro, 2 tablespoons of freshly squeezed lime juice, 1 minced garlic clove, and a pinch of salt. Add water as needed to achieve your desired consistency.

**6. Simple Olive Oil and Lemon:**
Mix 2 tablespoons of olive oil, 1 tablespoon of freshly squeezed lemon juice, and a pinch of salt.

These sauces and dressings are all easy to make, healthy, and packed with flavor. You can adjust the amounts and ingredients based on your personal taste preferences. Simply drizzle your chosen sauce over your quinoa, roasted veggies, and nuts or seeds, and enjoy!

Remember, you can always store these sauces and dressings in airtight containers in the fridge for up to 5 days, so feel free to make a batch and use it throughout the week.
